> From: Mathieu Gervais [mailto:egoine_@...]
> Sent: Thursday, May 23, 2002 12:21 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [junit] Should JUnit determine if assert*/fail 
> is called in
> testFoo?
> 
> 
> >Does anyone think JUnit should give  some kind of warning
> >when no assert* or fail is called in a test* method?
> 
> there are some cases when it's "ok" to have no assert* or 
> fail. For example:
> 
> public void testM

Why not have a passed() method and an optional flag to require
that each test case calls passed() to indicate success?

Then if you want to test as JUnit currently works, you just leave 
the flag unset.  If you want to require that test cases explicitly
report success, set the flag and call passed() in all your test
cases?

Daniel
subject: RE: [junit] Should JUnit determine if assert*/fail is called in t	estFoo?
